solution_line_template: Twice the age of {starting_age} is {starting_age} x {twice} = <<{starting_age}*{twice}={age_at_twice}>>{age_at_twice} years old.
At {age_at_twice} years old, Mandy was reading books {five_times} x {starting_pages} = <<{five_times}*{starting_pages}={pages_at_twice_age}>>{pages_at_twice_age} pages long.
{years_later} years later, Mandy was {age_at_twice} + {years_later} = <<{age_at_twice}+{years_later}={age_after_years}>>{age_after_years} years old.
At {age_after_years} years old, Mandy was reading books {three_times} x {pages_at_twice_age} = <<{three_times}*{pages_at_twice_age}={pages_after_years}>>{pages_after_years} pages long.
Presently, she reads books that are {pages_after_years} x {four_times} = <<{pages_after_years}*{four_times}={pages_present}>>{pages_present} pages long.
